dialogues.KGB: No firing!  Who told you to fire? Who told you to fucking fire?  Fucking Hungarian amateur! We wanted him alive!
dialogues.Peter: Peter Guillam...  Very well. Is this where he got out?  Ricki Tarr, sir. One of my scalp- hunters. He's been on the wanted list for a year. Last job was Istanbul, bit of coat-trailing for a Russian convention.    Trying not to bleed to death. Fawley's got a first aid kit in one of his drawers. Get me a plaster will you?  Cut it on a drawer handle. When are we going to get some new furniture round here?  Lunch.  Smothered by the Mothers.  What does?    What?  Citroen.  Jerry Westerby, dismissed December 4th. And... Connie Sachs, retired November 28th. That's just two weeks after you and Control were forced out.  Probably relieved. She always struck me as unhinged.  Jim Prideaux.  You look tired.  Is feeling sick to your stomach a slight reservation?  Fine, Bryant. Up to Registry today.  Time you oiled this thing, isn't it?  You're kidding?  Mind the jewels.  You don't look pleased to see me, Bill?  Doing some research. Makes a change from sitting on my arse.  As the grave. When're you going to give us something to do?  Thanks anyway. Stick to sitting on my arse.  Thanks...  So, chit me.        At least get on to the main dealers first...  Have you got the number?  Well, hold on...  ... Alwyn? Chuck me the bag a minute, will you?  Thanks.    Of course.    Couple of Arab ploys look quite promising. Other than that, getting quite good at ping-pong.    I'll tell him. He'll be thrilled.  But I haven't been seeing him! So get your facts straight and get  Nothing would surprise me about Tarr.  What for?  The hotel. I have to see George.  George?      He doesn't know because there was no telegram! The whole thing...  What about the money?    Why didn't you tell me? That you had Tarr?  In case I didn't make it out of the Circus...  I should get some rest. And I suppose you should get your reading done.  I'm sorry.  I wanted to believe Tarr was lying.  All this time, thinking I'm fighting a war. It's a sham. Karla won years ago and we didn't even know it.    That was Karla? And he flew back to die rather than give in?  What did he look like?  Haydon heard the news at his club?  At one-thirty? The ticker-tape wouldn't be running.  So how did he know? Oh Jesus, George...  Jesus Christ. Haydon? How could he have known?  Then how did he know?  Who?  You alright?  Yes, George. I'll watch.  You'll go...  The boy stood on the burning deck whence all but he had fled. The flame that lit the battles wreck, shone round him o'er the dead...  ... Yet beautiful and bright he stood...  He's here.

dialogues.Percy: all wearing paper PARTY HATS. The effect is ridiculous and a little disturbing, like some Surrealist objet d'art. Guillam hears Smiley and turns, almost guiltily, and as he moves we see there is a FIFTH PHOTOGRAPH on a piece - and it is of Smiley himself. Smiley stares at his image.    You're losing your sense of proportion, Connie. Perhaps it's time you went out into the real world.  A new secret source of mine.  He has access to the most sensitive levels of policy making.  We have named the operation "Witchcraft."  The Minister agrees with me that too many secrets are blown around here. Too much failure, too many scandals, too little solid intelligence!    Meanwhile we're losing our reputation, our partners...    I've refused to share Witchcraft with our allies, so far, Minister.  My goal has been to establish his track record beyond all doubt. I think the time has come to approach our American brothers-in- arms.  I'm not interested in a one-off trade. I want on-going access to American intelligence.  With Witchcraft on our side, I think we can get anything we bloody-well want.  I followed the recipe.    (shouting from the other    What are you getting up to down there these days, apart from chasing our virgins...  Arabs... You can rent one but you can't buy one. Right Bill?  How's Ricki Tarr these days?  I require the matter of your discussion with Tarr.    I'm talking to you about a murderer. I'm talking to you about a defector from your own damn section! I'm accusing you of consorting with an enemy agent behind my back! Don't damn well shrug at me! How'd you like a term in prison?  So if I told you that Tarr had recently arrived in Paris would you be surprised?  And if I told you we happen to know that thirty thousand pounds mysteriously appeared in his bank account last month, would that surprise you?  Your man's a defector, Guillam. Got turned by the opposition months ago and now they've sent him back to us!  Never mind what for! To muddy the water, that's what for! Spread a whole lot of damn nonsense to get us chasing our tails! The point is this - he's heading for home. The first peep from him you come to the grown-ups, understood? Anyone you see at this table. But not another damn soul!

dialogues.Bryant: Mister Guillam? How's the family?  Okay sir. Yellow one for the bag sir.  We keep asking...
dialogues.Toby: What about Smiley?  all wearing paper PARTY HATS. The effect is ridiculous and a little disturbing, like some Surrealist objet d'art. Guillam hears Smiley and turns, almost guiltily, and as he moves we see there is a FIFTH PHOTOGRAPH on a piece - and it is of Smiley himself. Smiley stares at his image.     Help you with something Bill?      We need to decide if we're part of the past, or part of the future.  Could we see you Peter?  Percy would like quite an urgent word with you. Can you come now to the fifth floor? That would be so kind.  The Chief will take no calls, please, ladies...  We are having a conference.  What... what's this about George?  This is a mistake George, this is all...  Yes. And yes, I delivered them.  ... but so did Percy...  ... and Bill...  And Roy...  Things aren't always what they seem. You know that George. Moscow thinks Polyakov's working for them, so, every now and then we give him the odd file to take back to them, just chicken-feed, keep his bosses happy. But Polyakov's our Joe, part of a big operation...  Why are we here? Why are we...?  I don't... I don't deserve this. I don't deserve this George!  Bland!  Bland or Haydon. I don't remember. One of them. Maybe Percy. I don't know who.  I didn't know. I swear I...  George...!

dialogues.Smiley: Have I time to change?      Are we going far?  Oh, I think I manage pretty well, thank you.  Very well.  Very bonny...    I am retired, Oliver.  No.  What did you say to him?    No, we never did.         Control lived with his sister didn't he?  We're only looking for short term rentals. Within the last year.  How long was H. Staunton a tenant?       Thank you. Anywhere will do.    I want to see the records of staff recently retired. While you're there get the handbook on staff duties... and the diagram of the Circus's reorganization under Alleline...           I know that car.  Not much, I'm afraid. We were just discussing the departure of Connie Sachs. I wonder how Research manages without her.  That was one of her talents.    Yes, I suppose I am. Perhaps that's what we have to become? A little paranoid?    Yes. Yes, he did.  Control was out. And Alleline was in. Thanks to...  ... Alleline's "special source."  Everything is connected.  Return to Oxford please.             You left the Circus shortly after I retired...    Which bone?  Polyakov.  Stationed where?  Esterhase said that?  But you disagreed?    What did you do?  What did they say?               If it's genuine it's gold-dust. But its topicality makes it suspect.  Where does it come from? What's the access?  But how could he possibly have access to...?             Yes.  Request for a thousand pound's in cash from the reptile fund.  For a Mister Ellis.  It was one of Jim Prideaux's work names.  The date. Prideaux was killed in Hungary a year ago. October twenty first. So why was  someone giving him a thousand pounds two months later?             Hello, Ricki.  You missed a wedge.  Where've you been, Ricki?  Who is?  I'm going to try. How long have you been here?  I wouldn't use my home as a safe house. There's every chance they're watching it.  What do you want Ricki?  What woman?     You were due to fly home the next day. What did you tell London?  Sense what?     What made you so sure she wasn't coat-trailing?  She had children in Russia?       And what did your message say, Ricki?  What else?  I understand how you felt. You wanted to do something.  Yes. I quite see that.  And what else?  What happened next Ricki?     Where are you going Ricki? You said yourself, Karla will be looking for you. I can take you somewhere. Keep you safe.  (grateful to get away  Yes. I didn't sleep well. I want you to get something for me, Peter. I need the duty officer's log book for last November. I'm sorry, but I'm going to have to send you up a floor, into the Lion's den. If you have the slightest reservation...  If you're caught, Peter, you can't mention me. I'm sorry, but you're alone.  Ricki's been helping us Peter. He's been telling us all about his adventures.  As you did take the trouble to steal it...  Ricki, you said you sent the Circus a telegram concerning Irina's information?  What was the date?  November 20th is missing. Someone is covering their tracks Peter. Unless you think that's just a coincidence?  Thirty thousand isn't so much for Karla to pay if it protects his Mole. I'm afraid someone in the Circus knows all about Mister Tarr and is doing everything they can to discredit him.  You recognize that handwriting? That's Toby Esterhase.  Secrecy is a habit.      What for?    In fifty-five. Moscow Centre was in pieces. Purge after purge. Half their Agents were jumping ship and I travelled around signing them up. Hundreds of them.  One of them was calling himself Gerstmann. He was on his way back to Russia, and we were pretty sure he was going to be executed. Plane had a twenty-four lay over at Delhi, and that's how long I had to convince him to come over to us instead of going home to die.  Little room...I'm sitting here...he's sitting there...  The Americans have had him tortured.  No fingernails. It's incredibly hot. I'm very tired and all I want to do is get this over with and get back home. Things weren't going well with Ann.  I give him the usual pitch... Come to the West and we can give you a comfortable life. After questioning. Or you can catch your plane and fly home and be shot, like Bykov, Shur, Muranov...    Use my lighter.  "We could arrange for her to join you, we have a lot of stock to trade. If you go back, she'll be ostracised. Think of her. Think about how much she..."  Kept harping on about the damn wife! Telling him more about me, than... Should have walked out, of course, but for some reason... it seemed important to save this one.  So I go on. "Know you're a chain-smoker, help yourself," "We're not so very different you and I.."    Never said a word. Not one word. Next morning he got back on his plane, gave the pack of cigarettes back to me, untouched - this was a chain-smoker, mind - and flew off to what he presumed would be his death. He kept my lighter. It was a gift - "To George, from Ann. All my love."  Yes.  And that's how I know he can be beaten. Because he's a fanatic. And the fanatic is always concealing a secret doubt.  That's the thing.  I can't remember.  After today, Peter you have to assume they're watching you. If there's anything you need tidied up... now's the time.    You rang my house?  What did you say?  Go on.  The Saville.  Peter...  It's not him, Peter.                           Yes. Pleasant enough.     Which means I was...?  What did you make of it, Jim? Control's theory?  But still you went? Risking your life for a mission you thought was absurd? Why?  Perhaps some part of you wanted to know if Control was right? Wanted to know if there was a Mole, who it might be?  What did you tell them?    What was your last line of defence?  Why?  What else?  Did they ask about me at all?  What did he say about me?    Try and put it all behind you, Jim.  Jim?    He said when he got out, when he was being debriefed at the Nursery, he had a visitor.  Toby Esterhase.  He gave him a thousand pounds. Told him he was dead now and couldn't come back. Had to become a Lotus Eater - forget everything that happened - Control's theory, Tinker, Tailor... all of it.  Yes, that's what I thought. How on earth did Esterhase hear about "Tinker, Tailor?"  Will you watch my back, Peter? Look out for a solo. Just a feeling I've had.        Perfectly, Minister.  There is a house, somewhere in this city, where Alleline and the others meet Witchcraft's London representative. I need the address of that house.    I'm glad you take some of the credit.  The man Alleline and the others meet is called Polyakov. You believe his role is to bring information from Witchcraft to you. His real role is to receive information from the Mole to take back to Karla.  Made possible. By you. When he steals our secrets he does it under the very nose of the Circus, in the house which you persuaded the treasury to pay for. I'm sure you'll be able to take full credit for that.  Just enough glitter, amongst the chicken-feed. Control didn't believe in miracles and he didn't believe in Witchcraft. But you were lazy and you were greedy and so you hounded him out of the Circus and you let Karla in.    You've opened negotiations to exchange intelligence with the Americans. What they tell the Circus, they'll be telling the Kremlin. Witchcraft's information, the "gold" Karla let you have? It wasn't to lure you. It was to lure the Americans. Now, do you want to take credit for that?  We have one thing the Mole wants.    Keep walking please.  I want to talk about loyalty Toby. Control recruited you when you were trying to escape from Hungary didn't he? A wanted man. Saved you from a KGB bullet, didn't he? And yet, when the time came, when it came to picking sides between him and Alleline, you didn't hesitate? Understandable perhaps, with your war experience. You've survived this long, I suppose, because of your ability to change sides, serve any Master?  It's about which Master you've been serving, Toby.  Intelligence has been leaked, Toby. Someone's been taking files from the Circus...  The files were delivered to a Russian attache, weren't they?  Operation Witchcraft? Yes, I know.  Who gave you the message for Jim to forget about Tinker Tailor?  To get rid of Connie Sachs? Westerby?  You're just the messenger? Running between them all. Anything to serve Witchcraft?  I know all about your secret source. And I know something you don't. I know who he is. He's Karla.  One of you has been giving Polyakov the Crown Jewels.  Are you still a wanted man, Toby?  You picked the wrong side, Toby.  Give me the address. Where do you meet Polyakov?  What are the safety signals?  Where is the mike, Mrs McCraig?  And what's the procedure?  If you're at all worried you can call Lacon from the basement phone. Let's try the tape recorder shall we?        I'm here, Mendel.  I was assured there would be no coercion.  If I can.  Of course.  I did have one or two questions. About Prideaux.  Yes, yes you did. That was good of you.  I'm surprised Karla didn't shoot him. Or do you think he held back out of delicacy towards you?  Did Prideaux come and see you before he left on his Hungarian mission?  To say what?    Did Karla ever consider having you take over the Circus?  What are you then?    Up to a point.               Shall we begin?
dialogues.Magyar: It's very good. Better than goulash. But you won't get it in Budapest now.  All the pigs have gone to Moscow.  I'll take you to him. Not eating?
dialogues.Jim: Why's that?  When do I get to meet your friend?  Would you excuse me a moment?  Come in, Roach.  Thought you were in sick bay? What are you...  What is it, Jumbo?  I'll be fine. You get back to bed.
dialogues.Prideaux: Why's that?  When do I get to meet your friend?  Would you excuse me a moment?        Hand those out.         Gave me a turn up there, parked on the horizon. Thought you were a Juju man. What's your name?  New arrival, eh? Middle of year? What's the story?  Bill? The unpaid Bill. Anyone ever call you that?  Known a lot of Bills. They've all been good `uns. What you good at?  You're a good watcher though eh? Us loners always are. No one else spotted me when I turned up here. Best watcher in the unit, Bill Roach is, I'll bet. Long as he's got his specs on. Right?  Free period, isn't it? Don't waste it down here.    Who's the fellow down there?  Who is he? Beggarman? Thief? Why doesn't he look this way?  Wouldn't you look if you saw a bunch of boys flogging a car around a field? Doesn't he like boys? Anyone sees him again, let me know. Don't hold with odd bods hanging about. Might steal the Alvis, which is...?            Come in, Roach.  Thought you were in sick bay? What are you...  What is it, Jumbo?    I'll be fine. You get back to bed.  Andras Benedek, Hungarian journalist based in Paris.  What information?  What else?     You were Beggarman.            Everything.  I held on as long as I could, to give everyone else time to get the hell out of there.  Did they?  My networks in Hungary. Did they get out?  The Mole. Control's crazy theory. I was going to bury that so deep, they'd never get it out of me. Which was a joke.  Because they already knew. They wanted to know how far Control had got in his investigation.  Circus gossip. Was Percy's wife still drinking, who was Bland screwing in the office. That sort of thing.  One of them did.  He had a cigarette lighter. Kept flashing it round for me to see. Showed me the inscription. "To George, from Ann. All my love." He reckoned after Bill's fling with her, she might want to change the inscription.  (Still looking to the  If they had one man like Bill Haydon they could call it set and match!  He gave me a cigarette.  I thought it was my last one.  I don't know her.  Do you know who she was?         I don't want you hanging around here. Keep away from me from now on. Go and join the others.  Just bloody join in. Go and play damn you.
dialogues.Control: Smiley is leaving with me.                     Step into my lair.    Report by Soviet High Command on their recent naval exercises in the Black Sea. Just what the Admiralty have been begging us for some information on.  I didn't. Percy and his little cabal walked in with it.  Shut up, Esterhase.  Smiley is suspicious, Percy. Smells a fake.  Percy doesn't feel like telling.  Percy and his pals have bypassed us, Smiley. Gone straight to the Minister. Everyone's very excited. Percy's to be allowed to keep the identity of his new friend top secret.  Luckily Percy's cabal has come to save us.  Your bloody Yanks!     I don't trust miracles.    Percy. Did you do this?  You penny pinching Scot. Can you not take a bloody order. No one is to tamper with the recipe. It's going to take us five hours to get drunk on this piss water.  Smiley? Where's Ann? Get me a lady of taste? Ann will sort it out.                    You weren't followed?  Trust no-one, Jim. Especially not in the main stream. What Hungarian identities do you still have running?  If you're caught, you keep me out of it. You were acting alone, bit of Private Enterprise. Understood?  I've had an offer of service. A Hungarian General. Wants to come over. I want you to meet him. He has information I need, Jim.  Rocketry. Ballistics. Bit of politics.    There's a rotten apple Jim and we have to find it.  I'm   so close I can almost feel his   heart beating. I know it's one   of five men. All I want from you   is one word.  Alleline - Tinker. (Points at the next photo) Haydon - Tailor. Bland - Soldier. We drop Sailor, it's too close to Tailor.  Esterhase - Poorman.

If it was up to me, I'd replace them all with those `naice' girls from registry. Like to hear a few high heels about the place.  Scrounge a fag?    Datsuns. Just got one. Wife made me. Hatchback. dialogues.Bill: You little prick Esterhase.  I'm not bloody chaining it outside. Mind you, probably no safer in here, with you bunch of cut-throats.  all wearing paper PARTY HATS. The effect is ridiculous and a little disturbing, like some Surrealist objet d'art. Guillam hears Smiley and turns, almost guiltily, and as he moves we see there is a FIFTH PHOTOGRAPH on a piece - and it is of Smiley himself. Smiley stares at his image.  Looking for his Majesty.    Sir, Roach, sir. Bill. I'm a new boy.    No sir.  Nothing sir.    What the hell are you doing up here?  Why would I be? You bloody pariah.  We like the Scalp-hunters to know their place. On the second floor.  Heard it was quiet down there.  Haven't you heard? Technology's the future. No need for you apes anymore. I can get you a posting to Northern Ireland if that helps get the blood racing.  Get out.  Tell me.  I just picked up half a story on the ticker-tape at my club... Tell me.  You go and tell your Masters what will happen if one hair on Jim Prideaux's head is damaged...  Get Esterhase on the phone. Tell him to pull in the Hungarian agents, anyone we're onto. Tell him to get down to the London School of Economics, sandbag some bloody students and put them on ice at Sarratt.  We need to go to his flat. Clear out anything linked.  Good flight? description: In the early 1970s during the Cold War, the head of British Intelligence, Control (Sir John Hurt), resigns after an operation in Budapest, Hungary goes badly wrong. It transpires that Control believed one of four senior figures in the service was in fact a Russian Agent, a mole, and the Hungary operation was an attempt to identify which one it was. George Smiley (Gary Oldman) had been forced into retirement by Control's departure, but is asked by a senior government figure to investigate a story told to him by rogue Agent Ricky Tarr (Tom Hardy), that there was a mole. Smiley considers that the failure of the Hungary operation and the continuing success of Operation Witchcraft (an apparent source of significant Soviet Intelligence) confirms this, and takes up the task of finding him.—David Brain
name: Tinker Tailor Soldier Spy
